intro: Monogynella reflexa, commonly known as the narrowleaf false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its stems are often hairy and can grow up to several feet in height. Monogynella reflexa is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
